III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The West Campus Building was formerly a part of Wedgwood’s Kentwood Campus, but
after renovations, a new population, different policies / procedures, and different staffing
ratio, the need for a different license was determined.
The well maintained and clean building is brick construction and has recently been
renovated. It is comprised of two living units – each able to accommodate twelve
residents. The living area is spacious and provides for good staff eyes on supervision.
The two living units are divided by a classroom area and a third living area designed to
keep residents in smaller groups. Eventually, the program plans to provide respite beds
to DHS and area CMH’s and will utilize this area for separate daytime programming.
2

B. Program Description
The Parramore Home has functioned for nearly two years as a residential program
serving autistic children and adolescents. Until now, it has been a part of Wedgwood’s
Kentwood Campus. With the expansion of D.D. Services to a second living unit
[VanderArk Home], specialized services can be better provided under a separate
license.
The Parramore Home’s focus is on the secure treatment of autistic children and
adolescents. Staff have been specifically trained to support this population. The
VanderArk Home’s program focus will be on developmentally disabled children and
adolescents with oppositional or acting out behaviors. While doors are locked for
resident safety, residents have access to a wide variety of on-campus and off-campus
activities and programs that include two gymnasiums, a health club with exercise
equipment, and a coffee house. Wedgwood also has a large grassy campus for walking,
sports, and other physical activity. Therapeutically, the program provides a parent
support group, life skills teaching, Functional Behavioral Analysis, Applied Behavioral
Analysis, Sensory Integration Services, Speech and Language Services, Occupational
Therapy Services, individual therapy, and family therapy. Residents have access to the
Employment and Training Program to learn job skills and to eventually be placed in an
on-campus job. Residents also participate in off-campus activities such as swimming,
community activities and events, and shopping.
In addition to a parent support group meeting at the facility, the program focuses on
coaching parents in the child’s home to build skills that expand the parents’ repertoire of
behavioral intervention techniques and assist the parents in implementing a consistent
Behavior Intervention Plan.
The Parramore Home’s policies and procedures have been in effect for nearly two years
and will be utilized by both West Campus living units. Residents attend various public
schools with services specific to their impairment being provided. Lighthouse School is
also developing a specialized on-campus educational program to meet the educational
needs of residents who would be better served without traveling to an off-campus
school.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The Kentwood Campus Renewal was completed on 02/15/2013. Parramore Home’s
resident files and staff files were audited as a part of that process. Interviews of staff
and verbal residents were conducted as a part of that license renewal. The Parramore
Home will become a part of the West Campus on 3/1/2013. Additionally, the new
employee files of eight staff hired to supervise and care for VanderArk Home residents
on the West Campus were reviewed. Verbal residents of the Parramore Home were
interviewed and expressed satisfaction with their care and the staff providing it. They
reported good meals and sufficient clothing. They also reported a variety of activities
3

and one resident reported a pending interview for the Employment and Training
Program, where he will be employed and earn a weekly paycheck. That resident
demonstrated social skills and cleaning skills that he had recently learned.
The West Campus is in compliance with all licensing rules and statutes.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that a license be issued to this child caring institution, effective
3/1/2013.
